newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria privatisation agency names new director.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria privatisation agency names new director.

text.p: The supervisory board of Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency said on Tuesday it had appointed Alexander Sabotinov as executive director to replace Vesselin Blagoev who was sacked last week.

Sabotinov, 46, is currently privatisation and investment manager at Raiffeisenbank Bulgaria. He worked at the Privatisation Agency from 1992 to 1995. His appointment is effective from Wednesday, a statement said.
Stepping up privatisation is a key part of Bulgaria's commitments to the International Monetary Fund under a new standby agreement due to go before the IMF board later this month for approval.
The Privatisation Agency is seeking financial advisors for the planned sale of 22 state firms, including Balkan Airlines, the Neftochim refinery, shipyards and steelworks.

The supervisory board said last week Blagoev had been dismissed because he showed a lack of initiative and flexibility in the privatisation process and a lack of coordination between the agency's executive body and the supervisory board and government. -- Sofia Newsroom +359-2 981 8569
